page.title: 18ODIHAM COMMON
page.content: Odiham Common is north-east of the town, near Broad Oak Village. The primary land cover is deciduous woodland, with enclosed, rough grazing land. Parts of the common are wet and boggy. The area supports a rich variety of plant and animal life. The largest building is the Old Hunting Lodge, with its own fishing pond. They are privately owned and well maintained by the owners. It is on the site of Henry V11's old hunting lodge. A smaller cottage in the area is owned by a well known actor. The common is a popular place for bird watchers, hikers and people, walking their dogs. Along the canal banks grow a variety of wild flowers and mature trees. Where the public are allowed to fish in the canal, there are Pike, Tench, Carp and Perch. A variety of water insects thrive in the canal.
